key_points: Prince Harry and Meghan Markle donated a large quantity of diapers to Harvest Home, a Los Angeles charity for homeless pregnant women.
The donation was made in collaboration with their charitable foundation, Archewell, and companies Procter & Gamble and Pampers.
Harvest Home expressed gratitude for the donation on their Instagram account, noting the contribution to their new Pico-Robertson Home.
The donation is part of the 'Million Acts of Love Campaign.'
The Duke and Duchess of Sussex became involved with Harvest Home after moving to California.
On Mother's Day, they made another donation to the charity through the Archewell Foundation.
Meghan, Duchess of Sussex, released a statement about the significance of community support and accessible pregnancy resources.
In her statement, Meghan highlighted the importance of mental well-being during pregnancy.
She also emphasized the challenges pregnant women of color and those from under-resourced communities face.
Meghan's statement underscored her commitment to supporting Harvest Home's mission to help vulnerable mothers.
